Articles.Content:
I was browsing the KSPedia in game when I saw that Scansat and Deepfreeze had taken the extra step to document their mods via the KSPedia ingame. I thought that was pretty cool, and wanted to know how many mods have integrated the KSPedia into it.

Edited April 28, 2016 by sardia
Yeah, the developers went out of their way a little to make sure any mod could add entries.  I can think of several mods that need it, especially RemoteTech!
I have plans to add KSPedia pages for all my mods.. and those ones that I did for DeepFreeze were really just placeholders - playing around with the new feature to get a handle on it.

9 hours ago, Alshain said:

Yeah, the developers went out of their way a little to make sure any mod could add entries.

Well modders aren't required to do anything, and while documenting their creations is highly appreciated, I'm just happy for the functionality  (most of the times).

But it was very good of the devs to open up the API and also document how documentation can be included in a standard way.

(Maybe this comes back to the fact that so many staff are modders in their sparetime )

Edited April 28, 2016 by Curveball Anders

See here:

It's not difficult to do, but it does take a fair amount of time if you want something other than a wall of text.
